open_questions.title: React Native, and how does it
open_questions.description: What is React Native, and how does it differ from React?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is React Native, and how does it differ from React?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: React Native is a framework for building mobile applications using JavaScript and React. It allows developers to write components that can be compiled to native code for iOS and Android platforms. React, on the other hand, is a library for building web user interfaces. React Native extends React to support mobile app development.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: The purpose of Redux in a
open_questions.description: What is the purpose of Redux in a React Native application, and how does it work?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is the purpose of Redux in a React Native application, and how does it work?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Redux is a state management library that helps manage the state of an application in a predictable and centralized manner. In a React Native app, Redux can be used to store and manage the application's global state, making it easier to share data between components. Actions are dispatched to modify the state, and reducers handle these actions to update the state in an immutable way.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: The difference between React Native and
open_questions.description: What is the difference between React Native and native app development?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is the difference between React Native and native app development?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: React Native allows you to build mobile apps using JavaScript and React, sharing a significant portion of code between iOS and Android platforms. Native app development involves writing separate code for each platform (Swift/Objective-C for iOS and Java/Kotlin for Android). React Native offers a cross-platform solution, while native development provides more control and performance optimization.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

referenceAnswers.text: React Navigation is a popular library for handling navigation in React Native. It provides a declarative way to define navigation flows and offers various navigators like Stack Navigator, Tab Navigator, and Drawer Navigator. You can use these navigators to navigate between screens in your app.

open_questions.title: The concept of props and state
open_questions.description: Explain the concept of props and state in React Native.?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "Explain the concept of props and state in React Native.?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Props (short for properties) are used to pass data from parent to child components. They are immutable and help make components reusable. State, on the other hand, represents mutable data that is specific to a component. It can be changed over time, typically using setState for class components or useState for functional components.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: The advantages and disadvantages of using
open_questions.description: What are the advantages and disadvantages of using React Native for mobile app development?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What are the advantages and disadvantages of using React Native for mobile app development?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Advantages: Code reusability between iOS and Android, a large and active community, rapid development, and access to native modules. Disadvantages: Limited performance for certain complex animations or heavy computations, occasional delays in adopting new native features, and potential challenges with third-party native libraries.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

referenceAnswers.text: Bridging is the process of connecting JavaScript code with native code (Java/Objective-C/Swift) in React Native. referenceAnswers.text: React Native and Flutter are both popular frameworks for mobile app development, but they have different approaches. React Native uses JavaScript and relies on native components, while Flutter uses the Dart language and provides a complete set of custom widgets. Key differences include the programming language, performance, and the UI rendering approach.

open_questions.title: DOM
open_questions.description: What is the significance of the Virtual DOM in React Native, and how does it improve performance?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a mid-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is the significance of the Virtual DOM in React Native, and how does it improve performance?" Requirements: - Explain in the browser runtime context - Give a practical example Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Explain in the browser runtime context; Give a practical example. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: The Virtual DOM is a key concept in React (and React Native). It's an abstract representation of the actual DOM, which React uses to efficiently update the real DOM when changes occur. By comparing the Virtual DOM with the previous state, React minimizes DOM manipulation and re-renders, resulting in improved performance.
keyPoints: Explain in the browser runtime context
Give a practical example

referenceAnswers.text: StyleSheet is used to define styles in React Native. It's similar to traditional CSS but with some differences. Styles defined in a StyleSheet are preprocessed and optimized during compilation, leading to better performance. Additionally, StyleSheet enforces the use of inline styles and prevents global style collisions.

Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: AsyncStorage is an asynchronous, key-value storage system in React Native for persisting data locally. It's typically used for storing small amounts of data like user settings or cached data. Its main limitations include limited storage capacity, lack of querying capabilities, and the fact that it's not suitable for storing large amounts of data.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

You can create separate files for iOS and Android, such as MyComponent.ios.js and MyComponent.android.js, and React Native will automatically choose the appropriate file based on the platform.

referenceAnswers.text: HOCs are functions that take a component and return a new component with additional props or behavior. They are used for code reuse, logic sharing, and enhancing components' functionality without changing their original structure. HOCs are useful for applying common patterns, such as authentication or data fetching, to multiple components.

open_questions.title: Redux Thunk, and why would you
open_questions.description: What is Redux Thunk, and why would you use it in a React Native application?

open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Redux Thunk is a middleware for Redux that allows you to dispatch asynchronous actions. It's commonly used for handling side effects like network requests in Redux. With Redux Thunk, you can dispatch functions instead of plain action objects, making it easier to manage asynchronous logic in your app.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

referenceAnswers.text: To optimize images in a React Native app, you can: Use responsive images by providing different sizes for different screen densities (e.g., @2x, @3x). Compress images to reduce file size. Use image placeholders or lazy loading for images below the fold. Cache images to avoid unnecessary downloads.

open_questions.title: How you can handle deep linking

open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Deep linking allows users to open specific screens or sections of an app by clicking on links from external sources (e.g., a web page or another app). To handle deep linking in React Native, you can use libraries like react-navigation to set up routing based on the deep link URL. Additionally, you'll need to configure your app's manifest or Info.plist files to specify the URL schemes or Universal Links for deep linking to work.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

referenceAnswers.text: FlatList is a highly optimized component for rendering large lists of data in React Native. It only renders the items that are currently visible on the screen, which significantly improves performance compared to ScrollView, especially for long lists. It also provides features like lazy loading, pull-to-refresh, and item recycling.

open_questions.title: The concept of "props drilling" in
open_questions.description: Explain the concept of "props drilling" in React Native. How can you avoid it?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "Explain the concept of "props drilling" in React Native. How can you avoid it?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Props drilling refers to the situation where you pass props down multiple levels of nested components, making the code less maintainable. To avoid props drilling, you can use React's Context API or state management libraries like Redux to pass data or functions down the component tree without explicitly passing them through each intermediate component.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: The purpose of the useEffect hook
open_questions.description: What is the purpose of the useEffect hook in React Native, and how does it differ from class-based lifecycle methods?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is the purpose of the useEffect hook in React Native, and how does it differ from class-based lifecycle methods?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: useEffect is a hook in React (and React Native) used for handling side effects and performing actions in functional components. It can replace lifecycle methods like componentDidMount, componentDidUpdate, and componentWillUnmount. Unlike lifecycle methods, useEffect allows you to organize side effects in a more declarative way and can be used in functional components.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

referenceAnswers.text: TouchableOpacity is a wrapper component that provides touchable behavior to its child components. It's commonly used to create interactive elements like buttons. When a user taps on a TouchableOpacity, it provides feedback by reducing the opacity of its child component, making it look like a button press.

open_questions.title: The concept of navigation stacks and
open_questions.description: Explain the concept of navigation stacks and navigation actions in React Navigation.?

open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: In React Navigation, a navigation stack is a collection of screens that are managed in a stack-like manner. When you navigate to a new screen, it's pushed onto the stack, and you can go back to the previous screen by popping it off the stack. Navigation actions are actions like navigate, push, and pop that allow you to manipulate the navigation stack and transition between screens.

Hot-reloading makes it easier to experiment and iterate on UI and code changes rapidly.

open_questions.description: What is the purpose of the key prop when rendering lists of items in React Native.?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is the purpose of the key prop when rendering lists of items in React Native.?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: The key prop is used to give a unique identifier to each item in a list when rendering in React Native. It helps React efficiently update and reorder elements when the list changes. Having unique keys ensures that React can identify which items have been added, removed, or rearranged, resulting in improved rendering performance.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

referenceAnswers.text: react-native-vector-icons is a library that provides a collection of high-quality icons for use in React Native applications. You can include icons in your app by importing the desired icon component from the library and rendering it within your components. For example, you can use the FontAwesome icon set like this: import FontAwesomeIcon from 'react-native-vector-icons/FontAwesome'; // Inside your component's render method <FontAwesomeIcon name="star" size={30} color="gold" />

referenceAnswers.text: The React Native Debugger is a standalone debugging tool that helps developers inspect and debug React Native applications more effectively. It provides features like real-time code inspection, a Redux DevTools extension, and a JavaScript console. Developers can use it to inspect the component tree, monitor state changes, and debug JavaScript code in a more controlled environment.

referenceAnswers.text: Offline-first development focuses on ensuring that an app remains functional even when the device is offline or has a poor network connection. It is important for providing a seamless user experience. Strategies for implementing offline-first functionality include caching data locally, using service workers, implementing background synchronization, and gracefully handling network errors.

referenceAnswers.text: CodePush is a service provided by Microsoft that enables developers to push updates to a React Native app without going through the app store approval process. It allows you to deploy bug fixes, feature updates, and other changes directly to users' devices. CodePush works by delivering JavaScript bundle updates to the app, which can be applied on the next app launch.

Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

referenceAnswers.text: Babel is a JavaScript compiler that is commonly used in React Native projects. It allows developers to write modern JavaScript code (ES6/ES7) and transpile it into a version of JavaScript that is compatible with the target platforms (iOS and Android). Babel is crucial for ensuring cross-platform compatibility and enabling the use of the latest JavaScript features in React Native applications.

referenceAnswers.text: A ref in React Native is a way to access and interact with a DOM node or a component instance directly. It is often used when you need to imperatively control a child component, access its methods, or get information about it. Refs can be created using React.createRef() or using the useRef hook in functional components.

Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: How you can handle offline data

referenceAnswers.text: To handle offline data synchronization, you can use technologies like Redux Offline, which provides a framework for caching actions and data for offline use and synchronizing them when the device reconnects. Strategies for data consistency include conflict resolution mechanisms and maintaining a clear data synchronization flow to ensure that data updates are applied correctly when the device goes offline and back online.

open_questions.title: The purpose of React Native CLI
open_questions.description: What is the purpose of React Native CLI and Expo CLI.?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is the purpose of React Native CLI and Expo CLI.?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: React Native CLI and Expo CLI are two command-line interfaces for React Native development. React Native CLI: It is the official CLI for React Native and offers more control and flexibility over the development process. It requires additional setup for native modules and may involve platform-specific configurations. Expo CLI: It is a third-party tool that simplifies React Native development, providing a wide range of pre-configured native modules and services. Expo apps can be developed more quickly but may have limitations in terms of custom native code integration.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

referenceAnswers.text: To handle internationalization and localization in React Native, you can use libraries like react-intl or i18next. These libraries provide mechanisms for translating text and formatting data according to different locales and languages. You can define language files with translations and switch between them based on user preferences.
